textos_fuente.text: New Phatz Sports Bar & Grille nearly ready to open in Fort Pierce Search query Search the web Skip to main News Finance Sports More -1 Manage your account Help Add or switch accounts Sign out Search the web Advertisement Advertisement Return to Homepage Don't Miss: Top items left at hotels Stylish NFL clear bags debut Miranda Kerr’s daily rituals September produce cooking guide Swift wedding in Sweden? Secret habits of tidy people Budget protein tips Swift & Kelce wedding venues Garage sale bestsellers Plane chimes: what they mean TCPalm | Treasure Coast Newspapers New Phatz Sports Bar & Grille nearly ready to open in Fort Pierce Rachelle Barrett, Treasure Coast Newspapers Tue, January 21, 2025 at 10:05 AM UTC 2 min read Final touches are being done on construction of the new Phatz Sports Bar & Grille in Fort Pierce, but the owners haven't set a grand opening date or a closing date for their Phatz Chick N Shack across the street. The new restaurant will have a full bar and outdoor patio — and bring back the Soul Food Sunday Brunch, said Tessa Adams, who co-owns Phatz with husband Robert and son Antoine Barber, all Treasure Coast natives. “We’re just doing a revamp with a new name and new vibe," she said. “We rented across the street, but they didn’t want to sell to us, so we decided to go and do our own thing — a sports bar that’s Black-owned." Rendering of the new Phatz Sports Bar & Grille located at 421 N U.S. Highway 1 in Fort Pierce. They aim to have "the finest sports bar on the Treasure Coast,” with the same menu that includes their top-selling Buffalo wings with their signature fingerlickin sauce as well as tacos, never-frozen burgers and hand-breaded seafood. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Phatz is relocating from 421 N. U.S. 1, where it's been since 2018, to 412 N. U.S. 1, where it razed the former Ace window tinters and Baslow Hentschel Motors buildings to make room for the new restaurant. Phatz began with two food trucks and the original restaurant at 1529 Avenue D in Fort Pierce, known as the Chronicle Newspaper building, which they still own. They moved to the current rented location in August 2020. All things food: Roundups of the latest reviews, inspections, new and best restaurants New restaurant: New owner takes over former Kork, Xega and DelBar restaurants The family opened their original Vero Beach location at 4211 20th St. in August 2017, but moved it to 1555 U.S. 1 in the Indian River Plaza in November 2019. They'll be giving it the same sports bar vibe as the new Fort Pierce restaurant. Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement They converted the former Phatz space into a Greedy Burger , named for a popular item on the Phatz menu. It was in business only a year, from September 2020 to December 2021. Now that location is home to Palos Tacos. Phatz still uses a trailer for catering. Rachelle Barrett is TCPalm's general assignment reporter. Contact her at rachelle.barrett@tcpalm.com.
